executive_summary.market_state: Severe breakdown in progress with capitulation-level volume
executive_summary.current_position: Free fall below all major support levels
executive_summary.primary_recommendation: AVOID long positions. Consider bear put spreads on any relief bounce to resistance zones. Current breakdown suggests further downside to $380-390 zone before stabilization.
executive_summary.key_insight: TSLA experiencing massive -5.65% decline with extreme volume (5.25M), breaking below critical $420 support. All moving averages violated. This is a capitulation event suggesting further downside before any meaningful bounce.

observations: Price collapsed from $440 to $402 (-8.6% from recent range)
All moving averages decisively broken to downside
No support levels holding - clean air below current price
Supply/Demand notation shows 'Increase in volatility, Supply & Demand fairly balanced' - but price action shows supply dominance
Intraday shows relentless selling pressure throughout session
No meaningful bounces or support attempts
Price in free fall pattern - consecutive lower highs and lows
Currently testing $402 with no signs of reversal

support_levels.description: Next major psychological level, gap fill potential
Major support from prior consolidation (visible on 4H)

resistance_levels.description: Broken support now major resistance, recent breakdown level
Major resistance zone, top of broken range

atr_14.estimation_method: Visual chart analysis based on recent massive candle ranges

volatility_regime.description: 95th percentile - extremely elevated, panic selling conditions

stop_loss_parameters.reasoning: High volatility regime requires 0.75x ATR multiplier to avoid excessive risk

scenarios.reasoning: Extreme volume breakdown with no support holding. Momentum strongly bearish. Typically after such capitulation, price continues lower before finding support. Next logical target is $380-390 zone.
supporting_factors: Massive volume breakdown indicates institutional selling

scenarios.reasoning: After extreme selling, often see relief bounce as shorts take profits and bargain hunters enter. However, bounce likely to be sold into resistance at $420. This is a selling opportunity, not reversal.
supporting_factors: Dip buyers attempting to catch bottom

scenarios.reasoning: Least likely in immediate term. After such violent moves, typically see either continuation or sharp bounce, not consolidation. Market needs to exhaust one direction first.

entry_criteria.price_condition: Any bounce to $405-410 range for better entry
entry_criteria.volume_condition: Continued elevated volume on down moves
entry_criteria.confirmation: Failure to reclaim $410 on bounce attempts

options_strategies.name: Short Call Spread (Bounce Fade)

entry_criteria.price_condition: IF price bounces to $415-420 resistance zone
entry_criteria.confirmation: Rejection candle at $420 resistance, failure to break above

options_strategies.rationale: Broken support becomes resistance. Any bounce into $420 zone likely to be sold. Collect premium from failed rally attempt.

targets.profit_mechanism: Premium decay as price fails to rally

stops.reasoning: Break above $425 would invalidate bearish thesis

options_strategies.name: Long Put (Aggressive Breakdown Continuation)

entry_criteria.price_condition: Any bounce to $408-412 for better entry OR break below $400
entry_criteria.confirmation: Continued momentum breakdown, no reversal patterns

options_strategies.notes: Higher risk due to naked put, but maximum profit potential. Only for traders comfortable with volatility.

stop_loss_methodology.notes: Increased max risk to 0.30% given high probability setup with extreme volatility

entry_signals.name: Bounce Fade Entry
entry_signals.notes: PREFERRED ENTRY - Better risk/reward than chasing current price

entry_signals.name: Breakdown Continuation
entry_signals.trigger: Break and close below $400 with volume
entry_signals.notes: Chase only if conviction is strong and volume confirms

entry_signals.name: Resistance Rejection
entry_signals.trigger: Price rallies to $420 and gets rejected
entry_signals.notes: Highest probability fade setup at major resistance

stop_losses.reasoning: Above this level invalidates breakdown thesis
Break above $425 shows genuine reversal, not dead cat bounce

stop_losses.condition: If price consolidates at $400-405 for 4+ hours
stop_losses.reasoning: Stalled breakdown reduces probability of continuation

factors.assessment: At extreme breakdown level - high importance
End of session - continuation likely next day
Excellent R/R on bounces to resistance

primary_setup.name: Bear Put Spread on Relief Rally
primary_setup.condition: IF price bounces to $408-412 zone (relief rally)
primary_setup.probability: High (65% success rate on bounce fades after capitulation)

alternative_setup.name: Direct Breakdown Play
alternative_setup.condition: IF price breaks below $400 with volume spike
alternative_setup.action: THEN buy $400 puts or $400/$380 put spread
alternative_setup.notes: Only chase if volume and momentum confirm continuation

avoid: ANY long call positions - this is a breakdown, not a dip to buy
Trying to catch the falling knife - wait for stabilization or bounce first
Overleveraging despite high conviction - volatility is extreme
Holding through bounces - take profits on target hits, re-enter on rallies

key_takeaways.takeaway: TSLA in full capitulation mode: -5.65% with extreme 5.25M volume, breaking all major support and moving averages
Continued breakdown to $380-390 most likely (55%), with relief bounce to $410-420 possible (30%) but should be faded
Wait for relief bounce to $408-412, then enter bear put spreads targeting $380-390 (65% success rate, 1:2.8 R/R)
Position size: 19.5% of options capital with stops at $415 (wider stops needed for extreme volatility)
This is NOT a dip to buy - it's institutional selling. Avoid long positions. Broken support at $420 now becomes major resistance.

verification_items: Risk parameters calculated before strategy selection
Market context reviewed - extreme breakdown identified
quality_control.notes: High confidence due to clear technical breakdown with extreme volume confirmation. Multiple timeframe alignment strengthens analysis.

immediate_actions: Set price alerts at $400 (psychological support), $410 (bounce level), $420 (major resistance)
Monitor for ANY bounce to $408-412 for optimal bear entry
Prepare bear put spread orders in advance
Have stops ready at $415 (put spreads) or $425 (call spreads)

market_open.focus: Watch for gap direction. Gap down = continuation likely. Gap up = potential bounce to fade.

mid_day.focus: Monitor for relief bounce to $408-412 resistance. This is optimal entry zone for bears.

power_hour.focus: Often see continued selling or stabilization attempts. Close below $400 = very bearish for next session.

decision_timeline.immediate: Next session open - Watch gap and initial direction
decision_timeline.short_term: Next 24-48 hours - Expect either continuation to $380-390 OR bounce to $410-420
decision_timeline.contingency: If price reclaims and holds $420, bearish thesis invalidated - reassess

moving_averages.interpretation: Catastrophic breakdown below all major moving averages. Very bearish signal. MAs now all overhead resistance.

volume_analysis.volume_interpretation: Extreme volume spike (2.1x average) confirms genuine institutional selling, not just low-liquidity drift. This is distribution, not accumulation.
volume_analysis.volume_trend: Parabolic increase on breakdown - panic selling

recent_price_action.speed_of_decline: Accelerating (10 days for -12.49%, with -5.65% today alone)

pattern_recognition.secondary_pattern: Failed consolidation leading to waterfall decline
pattern_recognition.continuation_pattern: Likely to see either immediate continuation OR dead cat bounce that fails
pattern_recognition.reversal_requirements: Would need: volume exhaustion, hammer/bullish engulfing candle, AND reclaim of $420+ to signal reversal

comparable_setups.similar_historical: High-volume breakdown patterns in TSLA historically lead to 10-15% total declines before stabilization
comparable_setups.notes: TSLA has history of violent moves. After such capitulation, typically sees further 5-8% downside before finding support.

bullish_scenario.notes: Low probability. Would require major catalyst or extreme short squeeze.

neutral_scenario.invalidation: Break in either direction with volume
neutral_scenario.notes: Least likely after such violent move. Market usually needs to exhaust in one direction.

bearish_scenario.notes: HIGHEST PROBABILITY. Momentum, volume, and technical damage all support continued downside.

upside_risks: Dead cat bounce could spike to $415-420 quickly (fade opportunity)
Short squeeze if too many piled into shorts at lows
Unexpected positive news/catalyst could reverse sentiment
Extreme oversold readings might trigger algorithmic buying
downside_risks: Momentum is extremely bearish - further capitulation to $380 or lower very possible
All moving averages broken - technical damage severe
Volume confirms institutional selling, not retail panic
No support levels visible until $380 zone
neutral_risks: Extreme volatility makes both timing and sizing difficult
Whipsaw risk if attempts to stabilize
Options premiums likely very elevated - reduces edge
Gap risk overnight in either direction

execution_notes.optimal_entry_timing: Wait for ANY bounce to $408-412 for optimal risk/reward rather than chasing current price. Patience will be rewarded.
execution_notes.position_management: Scale into bearish positions on bounces. Take profits on target hits. Re-enter on rallies to resistance.
execution_notes.hedge_considerations: Use spreads rather than naked positions to limit risk in extreme volatility. Put spreads provide defined risk.
execution_notes.slippage_concerns: Options will have wide spreads due to volatility - use limit orders only, never market orders
execution_notes.iv_considerations: Implied volatility extremely elevated - premium sellers may have edge IF price stabilizes, but trend is strongly down so focus on directional bearish plays

alerts_to_set.action: Watch for breakdown confirmation or bounce
Exit bearish positions - breakdown thesis invalidated
Prime fade zone for call spreads or adding to puts
Take remaining profits, reassess for reversal

final_assessment.confidence_in_analysis: High (82.0%) - Clear breakdown with volume confirmation on multiple timeframes
final_assessment.action_urgency: High - but patience for bounce improves risk/reward significantly
final_assessment.recommended_approach: Wait for relief bounce to $408-412, then aggressively fade with bear put spreads. Alternative: chase breakdown below $400 ONLY if volume confirms.
final_assessment.critical_level_importance: EXTREME - Broken support now major resistance. Reclaiming this with volume would invalidate bearish thesis. Failure to reclaim confirms continued downside.
final_assessment.trader_mindset: This is a high-conviction bearish setup with extreme volume confirmation. However, don't chase - wait for bounces to optimize entry. Take profits at targets and re-enter on rallies. This is NOT a reversal opportunity yet.

tsla_vs_market.interpretation: TSLA significantly underperforming market, showing stock-specific selling pressure beyond general market weakness. This is idiosyncratic breakdown, not just market sympathy.

comparative_analysis.correlation_notes: While SPY also weak, TSLA breakdown is 5x worse, suggesting company-specific issues or sector rotation out of high-beta tech. TSLA often leads market volatility - this could be warning sign for broader tech.

additional_considerations.earnings_proximity: Unknown from chart - check if earnings approaching as volatility could be related
additional_considerations.options_expiration: High options volume day visible - could be related to monthly/weekly expiration driving volatility
additional_considerations.institutional_flow: 5.25M volume suggests major institutional positioning change - not retail driven
additional_considerations.sentiment_shift: Capitulation-level volume often marks intermediate-term lows, but typically AFTER additional downside of 5-10%

pre_trade: Confirm account has sufficient buying power for 19.5% allocation
Calculate exact number of contracts based on position size
Set limit orders at favorable prices - don't chase
Verify stop loss levels are programmed
Check options liquidity and bid-ask spreads
during_trade: Monitor for bounce to $408-412 entry zone
Watch volume on any rallies (declining = fade opportunity)
Look for rejection candles at resistance
Be patient - don't force entry if setup doesn't develop
Scale into position if available (50% then 50%)
post_trade: Set profit target alerts at $390 and $380
Move stops to breakeven if profit reaches 1:1 R/R
Scale out at profit targets, don't get greedy
Document trade for review and learning
Prepare to re-enter on next rally to resistance

risk_disclaimer.volatility_warning: TSLA showing extreme volatility (95th percentile). Position sizing MUST be conservative despite high conviction. A -10% move ($40) is possible in single session.
risk_disclaimer.gap_risk: Overnight gaps of 3-5% are common in TSLA during high volatility periods. Never risk more than you can afford to lose on gap through stops.
risk_disclaimer.options_specific: Options premiums will be inflated due to elevated IV. Greeks (delta, gamma, theta, vega) will be aggressive. Understand your exposure.
risk_disclaimer.reversal_risk: While bearish bias is strong, violent reversals are also TSLA's trademark. If $420 reclaimed with volume, exit bearish positions immediately.
